DataElement.preferredName: Patient Begin Protocol Therapy Refuse Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text to specify the reason the patient refused/withdrew from therapy after beginning protocol therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to patient refusal of therapy after beginning protocol therapy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense.:An action plan for a clinical trial.  The plan states what the study will do, how, and why.  It explains how many people will be in it, who is eligible to participate, what study agents or other interventions they will be given, what tests they will receive and how often, and what information will be gathered.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

Concepts.definition: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

A formal document that describes a complete plan of research activity in the framework of a clinical study; specifically, the study objective(s), design, methodology, eligibility requests for prospective subjects and controls; intervention regimen(s), proposed methods of analysis of data; statistical considerations, and organization of the study. The protocol usually also provides the background and rationale for the study, but these could be represented in other protocol referenced documents.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify a reason or event that caused a patient to be removed from a clinical protocol.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: justification for or explanation of the administration or cessation of therapy.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
